website_summaries.verdict: A taller and narrower shape provide a updated design on this 5 gal. aquarium.
pros: Filter and pump on the back
Includes white and blue LED effects
Made from glass instead of plastic
The white light is very bright
cons: The filter works okay, but it may be harder to clean than others on the market

website_summaries.verdict: A top choice for first-time self-contained aquarium owners that combines sleek vertical style with adequate lighting and a robust filter system.
pros: Owners like the vertical profile of this tank, which saves shelf space
Plastic base is sturdy and holds aquarium’s weight well
Most owners are very happy with the tank’s lighting
cons: Filter area is narrow and difficult to clean
Rear compartment cover is flimsy and ill-fitting
Filter setting may be too high for betta fish
A few reports of filter failing after a few months

website_summaries.verdict: The upright shape of this aquarium is perfect for a countertop or small table. A good choice for Betta fish, goldfish, or a few small tropical fish.
pros: An attractive 5-gallon curved glass tank with Marineland's 3-stage hidden filtration system, and LED lights in both blue and white
Turn on the white lights for a daytime effect, the blue lights for a moonlit glow
Decorate with gravel, plants, and fish
cons: The filter housing is difficult to clean
Some owners said the lighting was faulty

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS LITTLE BEAUTY
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this Beautiful little tank so much I bought another one. I use it as a salt water tank. I also added a  and it works GREAT and looks nice also. if you are "thinking about" buying this....stop now and BUY BUY BUY you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shara

customer_reviews.title: Worst filtration later
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tank but TERRIBLE filtration. I did everything I could do to make this tank actually work, like my other tank (Aqueon, a brand I will now stick to) but there were always extreme amounts of particles in the water, after multiple deep ground-up cleaning sessions, and struggled to even access the pump in the first place. Actually killed one of my fish, who was the reason I got the tank, and put everyone else, including the snails, under extreme stress. I believed the reviews, did my homework. but leaves me regretting buying this less than a year later.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Yetter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Perfect Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Got it home and set up in no time. The set up instructions leave a little open to interpretation, but once you're done it's perfect! Bob my betta and his friends have never been happier. Highly recommend if you're not prepared to commit to a huge tank, but want something big enough for a few species and plants. The added heater keeps it a perfect 78 degrees too.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Not 5 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a five-gallon tank as advertised. It is, in fact, a 3.5-gallon tank. And 1/2 gallon of that if used in the back of the tank to hide the filter and pump. If you use the 1-inch rule for your tank to fill it with fish you must go by three gallons NOT five gallons. It is a nice tank for ONE betta and a couple of snails. or three one inch fishes. The filter is pretty ,much useless if you don't keep the tank filled to the brim.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fish Tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter fish tank. The glass work is really nice. Filtration system is good. Minor peeling of black trimming, easily fixed by glue. Overall style is very chic.
customer_reviews.author: jaynie

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tank...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiny little tank! I've always had large to very large tanks, and loved them, but due to current space restrictions, opted for this to go on a work desk. It runs quiet, filtration is adequate, no complaints!!
customer_reviews.author: Mudshark

customer_reviews.title: A great little 5 gallon for small space
customer_reviews.text: A great little 5 gallon for small space. Only thing is filter is very strong, found my betta stuck to intake. Modified by glueing sponge to slow flow into intake and only cycle his water twice daily for about 10 min each time. Love the tank, got it on sale ($42.00) and will buy again for work .
customer_reviews.author: review2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tank - so good I've bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This tank has surprised me. I've always been a 'bigger is better' for bettas when it comes to tanks, but this little tank has been far easier to maintain for my betta than my two 15 gallon tanks. I'm replacing one of those with another of these, and moving my solid black betta, The Iron Bull, into it to hang out near my betta in the current tank, Dorian. I know he will love it! Highly recommend. Quite, easy to keep clean, the water flow is not a problem and the lights are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn E. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad News
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this aquarium two years ago. It is a perfect size for the location it is in. The fish do well, however we have two problems: 1. a connector piece worked well for a year, but split after the warranty period. I used special tape to make the repair and hold the assembly in place. I also added a diffuser to prevent the water from getting out of the tank and ruining our floor. It is still holding. 2. replacement filters are available through Amazon, however the carbon filter is not. All we can do is wash it and reuse it.
customer_reviews.author: Marty K

customer_reviews.title: Great nano tank!
customer_reviews.text: This tank is great for anyone wanting a nano tank. I've wanted to have a small one for a while after getting bored with my 29 gallons, and this was perfect! There's enough space behind the false back to throw in a small heater but it is a bit tight. The water pump has a pretty high flow even on it's lowest setting, so you may want to modify it with a sponge or some mesh for a betta. Side-note, please don't cram a goldfish or something like that in here. This tank is suitable for one betta and even then 5 gallons is still the minimum for them. Please keep fish responsibly!
customer_reviews.author: Madison Katz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and attractive
customer_reviews.text: I think this an outstanding value for the price. I managed to fit a heater and a sponge filter in that back compartment along with the pump and filter it came with. People aren't kidding about the flow on the filter output. Big current. I did not feel like fishing it back out to turn it down so I put a different nozzle on the output to tone it down. Connection between the outflow and the riser from the pump is delicate so be careful with it but if it tears I'm guessing it can be repaired with some silicone tape.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, all glass, great filtration
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot of aquarium for the size and price. 1. The sides and top cover are glass, no acrylic, so no scratches 2. Hidden filtration is customizeable! Also easy to clean. 3. The filter intake (if the tank is filled to the fill line) is below the surface so food is not sucked into it. 4. The water return is pretty strong but can be aimed to the side, so it doesn't affect much below the surface. Overall, I love this little tank (I downgraded from a 60 gal) and would buy again. It sits on my desk and makes me happy just watching it. I planted it pretty heavily. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: L. Armijo

customer_reviews.title: Great tank but big draw backs
customer_reviews.text: Love the tank, itself. But, the rest definitely has some draw backs for what I’m using it for. I have a toddler and he was able to slide the tank off the stand. Dangerous for him, the fish and my furniture. The next problem is the pump. It is WAY to strong. The fish can’t swim around. No matter what I do, he just gets pushed against the wall. I had to turn it off. The pump is also hard to access and adjust. The last problem is the top. No easy way to feed the fish and the plastic piece over the pump and filter, is flimsy. It falls off and easily broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean
customer_reviews.text: I liked this aquarium for the first 30 days. Then ammonia started to build up and I could not get it under control without changing water. After much frustration, I found that the sides of the tank which holds the pump was covered with slime and that was preventing me from controlling the ammonia. I thought that this compartment could be removed when I purchased the tank - wrong! After 4 washings I still cannot get clear water so I am giving up. It's a beautiful tank until you have slime buildup.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BEGINNERS ... OR ANYONE ELSE.
customer_reviews.text: This was so poorly packaged that I could not even access all the parts required to put it together. Also, the website descriptions are inaccurate. There are no legs for the unit to sit on-the base is just a piece of plastic spacer between bottom of tank and shelf. You cannot adjust legs. The instructions are minimal. IT IS NOT FOR BEGINNERS! I read all the great reviews and one who said it was a piece of junk ... I agree, it is junk. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: TjB

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger fish.
customer_reviews.text: The tank looks stunning. However for the tetras I have, the filter intake is a bit large. I worried about them getting sucked in. Turning down the speed on the pump and putting some decorative plants in front of the filter, I haven't yet had an issue. The LED lights have limited angle adjustability, and they sit about 2 inches from the tank glass at the lowest adjustment. My tank sits on a high counter, and sitting at an eye level below the hood means you get an eyeful of bright-white LEDs. I fixed the issue with a makeshift collar around the LED array, but shouldn't have had to.
customer_reviews.author: AeonBoi

customer_reviews.title: This aquarium is great, the only downside is the back part of ...
customer_reviews.text: This aquarium is great, the only downside is the back part of the tank. there is a bout a 2 inch housing in the back that houses the filter and pump, which normally would be fine but the water in the back doesn't seem to get a ton of flow. I bought 2 shrimp and they ninja'd there way into the back where the filter is. I have no idea how to get them out and is far too cramped back there to get them out with a net. i do not advise this tank for escape artists such as shrimp and crabs.
customer_reviews.author: The_Slime_guy

customer_reviews.title: There are better tanks out there.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tank for about a year, in that time the pump went out so I had to purchase a new one aftermarket, the filter doesn't work well, the intake is too high, it doesn't do a good job of keeping the substrate or aquarium clean at all. My latest mod was to remove the plastic insert and purchase a small canister filter which works 100 times better. I could have bought a plain 5gal tank for about $15 because I no longer use the original lights or filter that came with the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bluerunner

customer_reviews.title: Attractive little tank, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool looking little tank, but it is noisy. I would NOT recommend having it in your bedroom, but it would be fine in a larger space or an office where there's a fair amount of ambient noise. I also find it difficult to clean because it's small and vertical - there's barely room to navigate cleaning tools around plants, etc. My daughter had a beta in it initially and it worked out well because the tank hardly ever got dirty. I now have it with four small tetra, some shrimp, and live plants - all are thriving and it looks great. I just hate how noisy the tank is.
customer_reviews.author: NEHS

customer_reviews.title: Great tank!  Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tank after reading the great reviews. I actually returned the Top Fin Engage tank due to poor reviews on the filter. This set up is great! It's quite and I was able to put my heater hygger 50W Mini Submersible Digital Display Aquarium Heater for Small Fish Tank, Compact and Fast Heating Thermostat, with External Controller and Built-in Thermometer, for Betta, Turtle and bubbler hygger Quiet Aquarium Air Pump 1.5 Watt Energy Saving Mini Oxygen Pump for 1-15 Gallon Fish Tank with Accessories White In the back of my planted aquarium. I just set it up with the live plants and will get my guppies in a few days! GREAT OFFICE AQUARIUM!
customer_reviews.author: ChicChickGoneCountry

customer_reviews.title: All well designed and integrated
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having aquariums for at least 7 years and this is the first time that I buy a prebuilt one. It has a good suction power of the water. Amazing lights for day and night. It has the perfect rounded shape on the glass so it’s easy to see each corner of the aquarium. Definitely recommended for all users. PD: The Only detail Is that the back area of the filter is a little bit hard to access to clean because of the little thickness, but it’s not a big deal with a good stick and sponge everything works well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony yatim

customer_reviews.title: Great tank for beginner aquarist
customer_reviews.text: This tank has it all, space for a heater, built in filtration, and slim and well design profile to make viewing any betta or 5-gallon suitable inhabitant, a pleasure. However, don't expect the filter to last beyond 2 years before giving out. The way the tank is designed makes it difficult to even replace the previous motor. Also avoid jumpers as removing fish that jumped into the back area is near impossible. A final note is that the filtration flow is really strong and can be over powering for some bettas. However, I had a very good experience with this tank and its affordability makes it a great candidate for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa N.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Construction Materials!
customer_reviews.text: I have several fitment issues with my Marineland aquarium. I have sent the company many messages, asking for assistance in replacing parts. The company has not acknowledged a single message. Unfortunately, one can only used Marineland's internal messaging system, so there is no record of assistance requests. Problems I am having: 1.Rubber pump tube connectors, are not tight enough...they keep being 'blown' off by pump pressure, even on low. To reinstall, one has to pull the pump out and clean. 2. Plastic filter chamber cover is too short, will not secure over the filter chamber
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: Love this aquarium! It's super modern looking which I love and works amazingly well. The only con I have about it, is that I wish the LED lights were a bit brighter, but other then that it's a beautiful aquarium. If you plan on purchasing shrimp to put in it you'll need to buy shrimps that aren't very small. My small red cherry shrimp somehow ended up int the back part of the aquarium near the filter and water pump. My guess is the holes for the water intake are a bit big. The only solution to this is to probably add some sort of mesh inside the filter wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Damas

customer_reviews.title: Very lovely
customer_reviews.text: Best tank for starters hands down! Betta fish will love it, just adjust the OUTTAKE by covering it with sponge, the water pushed the Betta fish around and He did not enjoy that, which tired and Stressed him out, after u tie a sponge around it it should turn the water to STILL WATER, which is what Betta fish like. the INTAKE u can always adjust it by taking it out from the tank within it, where the filter is located and adjust the levels. My betta fish liked the gentle intake and kept sticking himself on there on purpose so he doesn't have to swim around.
customer_reviews.author: Moonkitten

customer_reviews.title: You need to know this before you buy it.
customer_reviews.text: your supposed to have it almost full to operate correctly. However I have it lower and it works well. When the water is lower it shoots water back and splashes but that can be fixed with a sponge. I was able to put a Breeder Box on it as well. Size Med. large is too big. I’ll post a pic. Blue light is not a good selling point.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee Duncan

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful fish tank for beginners
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful sleek tank for my "very first" Betta fish. It's portrait orientation consumes less space and looks elegant. The portrait orientation also allows to decorate the tank-interior with smaller foot print. The two light modes (white & blue) are very practical; however, the lights appear very bright and have ability to excite inhabitant(s). The pump is very powerful and a bit louder at it highest speed; but at low speed it appears quieter. The filtration system works very efficiently and the filter is easily available. Overall I am very satisfied with tank.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: awesome tank poor filter system design
customer_reviews.text: I love this tank! but after constantly having to try and retrieve my fish and shrimp from the back, and several failed attempts to keep them out coupled with being unable to easily clean the back compartment. I took the entire system out and replaced it with a sponge filter. The only downside to this is of course seeing the filter, the upside is it makes the tank look WAY bigger and gives my fish and shrimp more room to swim. I think all in all it was an excellent ~$10 upgrade for a sponge filter and air pump. would def buy again if I wanted another 5 gallon, but would probably make the same modification.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice tank if you redo the filtration and lighting
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my daughter to house her male Bettas in. If you're going to keep something hearty, like a goldfish or a small school of fish, it would work ok. But the filtration as it stands is too strong for most small fish. The current forces them to swim for shelter. So, if you plan on using the built in filtration, get river swimmers. For Betta, we had to add additional bio media and sponges to slow the flow, and change the lights out to grow plants. I'll include a pic so you can see the possibilities. This is a great tank, but don't assume the build as it comes is right for you.
customer_reviews.author: Elvee

customer_reviews.title: Happy fish home
customer_reviews.text: This same tank in the stores is about $89 What a great price that is why I finally made the purchase, so glad I did!!! I really like this little tank. It is quite and the pump seems powerful, I’ve turned it halfway down and the fish still have a nice resistance. The Duel color lights are really nice. The only thing that made me a little sad (not worth knocking of a star) is the light seems to be bent and in even, I adjusted it how it sits on the back of the tank. The lid to the back is a little flimsy, yet again, the tank it’s self, the pump and the lights, so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Custom Saddle Seller

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little aquarium. It is the perfect size to fit on a counter or desktop. Because of its small side you can't really fit too many fish in there, but if you do your research you can find some fish or other Aquatic animals that are perfect for a 5 gallon tank. Be wary of the lighting, as it is very bright for a tank of its size and algae will become an issue fast. I have had no problems with the filtration or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Fugzine

customer_reviews.title: REALLY sucks: Looks nice but killed fish :(
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research in trying to find a nice beginner tank and thought this was it. It looks great and my kids so were so excited for fish. Unfortunately, the next morning after getting fish, I found one dead from being ‘sucked in’ by the filter. I definitely wasn’t expecting this, I mean, it’s a fish tank with a filter, shouldn’t it be able to filter the water at a reasonable level without killing fish? After seeing the dead fish, I looked at other reviews/questions and found I wasn’t alone. Now I’m trying to figure out what to do, has anyone found a fix for the filter to tame the suction?
customer_reviews.author: Fit Dad

customer_reviews.title: Disaster! Broke and flooded living room!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the photo, the aquarium cracked down the side. We awoke at 3am to a flooded living room and heartbreak over our perished betta. This is after only a few months of ownership. We can think of no reason for this sudden crack as nothing has changed in the aquarium recently. It was running quite well and smoothly. Our guess is a manufacturer's defect. It may be rare, but the consequences are huge - damaged floor, dead pets and a heartbroken kid. Stay away from this company!
customer_reviews.author: A. Price

customer_reviews.title: 2 arrived damaged, the white light doesn't work on 1
customer_reviews.text: We have had two of these aquariums. The filtration system on one was not working properly, and the second one arrived with the black film peeling off and the tank was too big for its lid. The lid of both tanks falls into the water. It's really annoying since it is completely set up, water treated, live plants installed, pump and filter installed and the lid doesn't fit. I can't put the fish in without a lid since we have 2 cats. Really disappointing.

customer_reviews.title: Viewing angles are great!
customer_reviews.text: It will be a little bigger than you'll expect but it's very pretty. I set mine up with live plants only along with shrimp and cod's (celestial pearl danios or whatever they keep changing the name to). Tank gets good enough flow from the included pump, however if you're gonna do a set up like mine, I'd suggest getting an appropriate light and changing the filter set up. I cut out the plastic in the filter tray and opted to use floss, sponge, and a bio bag with all the rocks and balls and stuff to help balance the water. Over all this tank is super unique and fits the modern look.
customer_reviews.author: lowell chase

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but leaks
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design and dimensions of this aquarium. The hidden filter setup gives it a clean leak. BUT, there is a problem. After taking it out of the box and setting it up and filling it, water began to accumulate around the base. I discovered a small leak in the bottom rear seam. This might be a simple fix, but now my setup time and chemicals are wasted. I'll have to go buy some sealant, wait for it to cure, refill it, hope it doesn't still leak, and wait another 24 hours before I can add some fish. What a bummer for something brand new out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: We set this up in the kitchen on the island, to enjoy the small fish we have and use the light for a night light. However, one of the fish the biggest of the three freaks out when we have the light on, both the day light and the night light. Just hides in the caves we provided. It is a small tank, even though tall, so you can't put a lot of fish in it. It would be a great Betta tank, but not for anything bigger, maybe a gold fish. Really love it though, and will probably put a gold fish in it when these guys go.
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Not working for my male Betta
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tank to upgrade my male Betta from the one gallon bowl he came in. Unfortunately, it’s not working out. The tank itself it good and the filter works, but my Betta sees his reflection in the shiny, black background and is constantly pacing up and down the back wall and flaring. I also had to create a baffle for the filter because it was pushing him around the tank even on the lowest setting. The lights seem neat and the decorations looks beautiful under the light, but he freaks out if anything is over the tank opening, so I can’t use them.
customer_reviews.author: BlueAngel43

customer_reviews.title: Betta and tank Died after only 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tank, but I can see where it could use some fixer uppers. First off the outflow is too powerful for a betta. It gets dirty very quickly, I am not sure how well that filter is working. Worse yet, water was testing perfect and 83 temp and my fish still died. Not blaming that one on the tank but, one can only wonder when 1 day after my fish died the tank ALSO DIED. 5 months.....and the tank is useless to me now without a running filter. Will contact the company and hopefully get some answers or a return. Currently....mixed feelings...One of them being disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: rachel g

customer_reviews.title: Be careful it’ll eventually crack!
customer_reviews.text: Had this Marineland aquarium for less than two years before it ultimately cracked and leaked. The crack was at the base and extended from one end to the other. I attempted to plug the leak but the nature of the crack was too extensive for any kind of repair. This aquarium was unreliable. It created a huge waste of time and effort to buy a different replacement and transferring everything over. The only place left for it is the trash bin. I highly recommend buying acrylic or plexiglass instead you're taking a chance with glass....
customer_reviews.author: Jimbone

customer_reviews.title: disappointed and not woth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Came with a chip in it and a faulty filter. By the time i figured out what was wrong. The return was up. Better off not buying. Also i am not fond of the pump setup at all and you can not put live plants in this tank duckweed or any other aquatic plants. The shape also makes it a pain to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Torie

customer_reviews.title: Floating tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect size tank for my four glow fish. The stand makes it almost look like it's floating. The light has two settings: regular white and black light. I have special ornaments in the tank which glow under the black light. The filtering component is hidden behind the tank. Genius! My hubby was blown away, too. The glass cover which is supposed to slide back under a piece of plastic is a wee bit sloppy, but not worth deducting stars for.
customer_reviews.author: kmps

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful aquarium
customer_reviews.text: We recently decided to upgrade out aquarium size after our last betta passed away. I knew I wanted a tank this size and it took a lot of back and forth for days to figure out the one that I wanted. Ultimately I chose this one because of the concealed filter and the more modern look to it. It arrived in perfect condition and was pretty easy to setup. I let the tank cycle for about a week and added my fish. They are all loving their new home at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: jennys

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tank. It's pretty big, heats up well, and pretty to look at. I love the lighting and how quiet it is. The suction power is adjustable. I leave mine at the lowest setting and it works great. Easy set up. I love how everything including the filter is hidden. Only complaint I have is that it's extremely heavy. My old tank was much easier to move so cleaning may be tough with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

customer_reviews.title: Self contained and simple
customer_reviews.text: I like this tank, we have a beta in it and a couple of snails for the algae. Add your favorite decorations, gravel and fish of choice and your good for an office or dorm. pick up plenty type Z filters also as they only last about a month but keep the tank clean if you dont over feed.
customer_reviews.author: Cigar Smoke

customer_reviews.title: At this price point it’s a steal!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little wonder is an amazing value. Just cycled the tank 2 twice and added a recently propagated lucky bamboo, added a few glo danios & a tetra, with a few happy snails and a choco pleco. Also our beta is hanging out with the community while her tank cycles. The top Keeps the cat out and the noise level low rivals more expensive units. Added a small epoxy to the rear top and tired the filter WAY down. Happy purchase! I modded the filter tray to add bio matters based off of a review here. Currently building a nano sump setup to start our next mini saltwater tank in the next portrait! Stay tuned!

customer_reviews.title: Get some small danio glow fish. Cute tanks
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my tv stand. They have 2 light settings, 1 black light, I regular led light. The one switch will toggle between them both. The filter runs quietly as long as you fill the water to the proper fill line (look inside tank) My only complaint is it's a 5 gallon tank but about 1/5 is taken up with the filter in the back so really it's like a 4 gallon usable space. You have to change the filter every 2 weeks or it gets grimy. The pic is of 1 with black light, 1 regular
customer_reviews.author: Shannon M

customer_reviews.title: great for betta- quietest pump ive found
customer_reviews.text: This tank is beautiful. If you want to add more filter sponge or media in back there is plenty room. youtube has plenty videos to modify tgis exact tank. Im using it for betta i turned pump to lowest setting and took OFF the water flow diverter on outiside. I left it to just flow naturally on top of water, this made force of water alot calmer oddly( youd think it be opposite) Im buying a second for another betta. This tank looks expensive BEST part is pump is quiet. I purchased and returned 5 tanks on amazon because pump was so loud.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Great Tank. Happy Betta. Added a Pre-Filter Sponge
customer_reviews.text: My little fishy looooves his house. He's been living in this tank for a month or so and he loves the vertical distribution. The flow can indeed be a little intense (if you've read other posts, some people have mentioned this). I got an uncut prefilter sponge, cut it to fit around the output and voila. It works so well that my aquatic plants are cranky about not getting enough water current and I am making adjustments. I highly recommend this tank to betta owners. A prefilter sponge is a very inexpensive modulator of current velocity. Best of luck and wishes for happy aquatic life!
customer_reviews.author: ebodane

customer_reviews.title: Nice tank, poor filtration.
customer_reviews.text: The glass is beautiful but all the plastic parts that come with it are very flimsy. The filtration system is poor, and does not do a very good job at keeping the tank clean. I had purchased on in 2015 that was amazing, but this one is not good. I recommend getting a different pump and filter. Even on a low setting the pump shoots water out fairly quickly and does not work well for a beta. Mine kept kitting pushed around and feeding was difficult
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs too much modification
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive tank, and it definitely looks good in my house. However, now that I’ve had it about six weeks, the bloom is off the rose. The filtration system is too strong for a betta, so after trying a few different solutions, I finally drilled holes in the tube taking water from the pump to be cycled back into the tank, and am getting a nano tank air stone. All in all, if I could do it again, I would get a wider 5 gal to allow for more swimming room, and just put in a simple sponge filter.
customer_reviews.author: Wish Monster

customer_reviews.title: Classic Little Tank 🐠
customer_reviews.text: absolutely beautiful tank for the price and it being glass you cannot feed this this is absolutely worth it if you're hesitating on the purchase, Don't... just know that it is not necessarily the best tank for a Betta it is a giant condominium for him "YES" but the water flow is too much for the beta that I got so I'm going to get another tank for him and find a different fish that can handle this water pressure from the pump. Otherwise I absolutely love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the product I could not wait to set it up in my new apartment. I read a review that another person had a betta and liked the tank. Everyone has different experiences and unfortunately my betta somehow was injured in the tank and lost some of its tail. He is hanging in there and I believe I want to return the tank because the noise level even bothers me across the room. My fear is moving this poor fellow again and really putting him into stress mode. Unhappy in Florida
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Great set-up,
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. All you need add other than gravel, décor and fish is a heater if your fish require water warmer than your room temperature. Most small heaters fit in the hidden filtration compartment behind the main tank. Remember this is 5 gallons tall, so not a good tank for fish that require "running room", but wonderful for very docile fish. I have a betta, who likes to hang-out near the top, and some small Cory fish that are bottom dwellers.
customer_reviews.author: NorthEasternBelle

customer_reviews.title: New Fish Home
customer_reviews.text: We had a beta fish and sadly once we moved our fish into this new tank it died the next day. We must have done something wrong but we recently bought new fishes and they are super happy swimming around. I love the tank, it looks really nice and the different lighting is amazing. You can put it to regular white light or do the blue light which is amazing for glowing fish. I recommended it to my brother and he said he will be purchasing one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Why did I get this tank???
customer_reviews.text: Love this aquarium!!! The built in filter is strong and provides plenty of water flow. The base, glass top and curved corner 5 gallon aquarium shows quality. The included light is bright but I would add a more powerful one for a salt water system. This is a fun aquarium, but remember the smaller the aquarium the more experience you need to have, to have success. The reason is, any problems with water quality has to be addressed immediately. So testing needs to be done whether its fresh water or salt water system. I have a 150 gallon marine tank and it's much easier to maintain. The reason I built a fresh water is plain, I miss it!
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Beginner fish tank
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this fish tank! I wanted to upgrade my son’s betta fish from a 1 gallon to something bigger. This is a perfect option! I love the vertical design. I have it sitting on our countertop between our living room and kitchen. It was also very easy to set up for a beginner. I’ve never had a fish tank with a filter before, but it’s pretty straightforward. I have mine on the lowest setting and my fish can swim fine. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Madeline P

customer_reviews.title: Form over function
customer_reviews.text: There is a false back wall that hides the filter and water pump. There is no way to effectively clean behind this area. So once you get algae in the tank... and everyone will at some point... there is no way to effectively remove all of it so it comes back quickly and takes over the entire tank weekly. Looks nice but hard to impossible clean thoroughly... plus the guy at pet store says most fish wont like a vertical tank. Just missed my return window so I'm just gonna toss it, bite the bullet and buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great little tank
customer_reviews.text: This is my second tank which I am now using. I love the design which hides pumps and heaters. I put my heater in back beside the filter careful not to let it touch hose from the pump. All you see is crystal clear water and your fish. I have put black sand and a few white rocks with live plants and it is beautiful. Works great, cleans easy and the glass top is a very nice touch. I also love the light that sets on top out of the water. My standard tank I had before had light mounted under the black lid which had to be replaced 2 times. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Overall very nice aquarium, if not the light
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great small aquarium - looking great, built in filter is okay, lovely lid. The only disappointing thing is the light - nowhere near enough even for a small tank like that. See the difference in lighting in a larger tank and this on the photo. Whoever is responsible for this product, you could easily quadriple the amount of LEDs - there is enough room! And the additional cost should not be a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small fish or a beta
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a first-time fish keeper, but it's been awhile. Ordered this after doing some research. I've added a heater and my little beta friend is thrilled. You may hear a slightly noisy water sound depending on your fill level and where the filter output is pointing. Pointing it down makes it for a pretty soundless experience minus a light hum, which is nice. Happy with my purchase and it's staying clean so far. Lid is a little weird just resting a pane of glass there, but does work well to keep the cat out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful quality tank
customer_reviews.text: This is beautiful nano tank fits great for n kitch undee cabineys in fat corner where a microwave once was. Is glass and has a short stand to make moving it easy . The light is bright guy and has two color settings. The set up was so easy and it started pumping immediately. It’s not noisy to me. In kitchen no one notices a slight humming. All you need is a substrate and fish ! It’s a perfect gift for anyone !!
customer_reviews.author: giana

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The Mainland 5 gallon portrait aquarium came in today and I immediately unboxed it and checked it over to make sure all parts were there. I filled the tank to check for leaks and set up the filter. I had read in the reviews it needed a notch for heater cords, I'm happy to report it has been updated to include the notch. The styling on this tank is sleek and modern, the seals are clean and well done. I am extremely pleased with this purchase. Easy to follow instructions and serup. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Franklin C. Volz

customer_reviews.title: Great aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my cat would stop trying to get into my tanks water...best aquarium I've purchased so far! The hidden filter does take up some of the gallon space so my decor fit a little tighter but still works out. Definitely recommend! *I also took the little spout off where the water comes out because I feel like it was pressurizing it so now the water flow is not too strong for my betta...I also hated that thing because at certain angles it would shoot water out the back of the tank which is potentially hazardous and just all around not good*
customer_reviews.author: Leann

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect easy start up and set up tank. I went from a 3 gallon to this 5 gallon and my fish love it. As with all the other reviews the only comment is the small plastic black piece at the very back barely sits on the top. Although just looking at the tank you can’t really tell. I added a bubble stone which really makes it look nice. I put the heater in the back section of the tank where the motor is even though the instructions told me not to and I have not had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Oski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, perfect tank
customer_reviews.text: This tank is awesome. It arrived quickly and with everything you need for a beta. I added some decorative glow plants, a few rocks and a heater. The small heater hides superbly in the back panel. I would recommend this tank to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: LONNIE KIRK

customer_reviews.title: Quality v. Price
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed at the quality for the price, I love the look and design but mine came with the back filter box panel pulling up from the glued seam. As well as the filter cord being packed at the bottom of the filter box not a big thing just annoying. Debating if I'm retiring or not it's really heavy and sturdy I feel. I currently have a 20$ tank for my betta.
customer_reviews.author: ROSE BANKSLY

customer_reviews.title: Good but take out the filter first
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tank but I had to modify it. I ripped out the filter and cleaned the excess sealant off and just run it with a sponge filter. It created a lot more space and I don’t have to worry about grime getting where I can’t reach. Plus the filter is too strong even on low for a betta. Just run a razor down the sealant on both sides and the bottom, then tear it out. Then take a flat scraper and clean the rest off. I highly suggest this right from the get-go. It is on the inside so doing so it doesn’t risk damaging the structural integrity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable, attractive tank!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tank! We bought this track as an upgrade for our one small Betta fish. Works great! Internal filtration is pretty, neat, and clean. Lighting options are pretty fantastic as well. It's good in the corner of our kitchen and looks classy! The All-Glass construction really impressed my husband and I... I was expecting Plexi! Lighting options are unique and the pump can be adjusted so that the current is not too much for lazy betta fish. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet B

customer_reviews.title: The best nano tank I've seen so far
customer_reviews.text: Quiet pump, beautiful seamless curved glass front, the bio-sponge has more than enough surface for nitrifying bacteria to remain at stable levels, even with filter cartridge changes, and plenty of room in the filter to put more media (which I did). The cartridge size it takes sadly has no adapters on the market to use with reusable filter material, so after going through a couple, I cut up a used cartridge, so now I can use bonded filter pad cut to size in there. Works great, and way easier to maintain without disrupting the cycle bacteria even a bit.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great For First Timers
customer_reviews.text: Fresh water aquarium first timer! This is a easy enough tank for a first timer to have. Very straight forward, filter isn’t the greatest, I have to rinse it just about once a week to keep the water from getting all cloudy in between tank cleans, which are also not the easiest. I do a half a tank clean and just scoop the rocks out to rinse them. Maybe it’s just tough for us to do because it’s in our daughters room and the tank is pretty heavy when full. But overall, great for the buy, not too noisy at all and we are housing 4 small glofish inside. They seem to love it in there.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but......
customer_reviews.text: I received this on the 17th and set it up a few days ago. It looks awesome setup and was quiet. Last night, I noticed a water puddle at the base. I was thinking it was because I had just tested the water and dropped water. I cleaned it up, then a few hours later I check the temperature. There was more water puddles around the base. Turns out there is a slow drip coming from the back left corner on the bottom. Ugh.... so now I’m emptying the tank, packing it up, and sending it back as soon as it’s dried. I took a chance despite the reviews. The design is idea, but poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great nano tank for plants and shrimps
customer_reviews.text: Awesome nano tank. I made this into a nano planted tank, low tech (Kessil light, excel dosing and no CO2), and plants have been thriving. I started off modding the filter to be come a cartridge where I can put in my own layers of sponge and other media (I followed details from one of the other reviews above), but have recently upgraded to an external mini canister filter (Finnex PX-360). No issues with the built in (but modded) filter, I just wanted one with bigger capacity so I don't have to clean that often. I'll let the picture speak for itself on how awesome this tank is.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank, perfect condition
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful tank. Arrived in perfect condition with all of the ins and outs included. The light is nice and bright, I don't use the "night mode"/ blue light but, it works nicely. Filter works great so far, I had to watch a YouTube video on how to turn the flow down but, that's expected. My betta is definitely enjoying the upgrade and seems to enjoy exploring the new tank.
customer_reviews.author: DandyGeckos0823

customer_reviews.title: Love This Tank!
customer_reviews.text: We acquired two Betas that had been kept in "tanks" WAY too small (should be in 2.5 gallon minimum), so we decided to upgrade their houses by getting one of these for each of them. They've been sooo active and happy since! This tank is easy to assemble, quiet (silent) and looks amazing! We added our goldfish to one and plan to get a couple of friends for each tank. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: AMD

customer_reviews.title: Makes your room look great and your fish super happy!
customer_reviews.text: This tank is so beautiful. Bright blue light or bright white light, has a nice waterfall sound. Best part is my fish was so unhappy in a small tank before and now he has so much energy and swims around all over the place doing deep Dives. I feel like he's a whole different creature right now and I actually enjoy watching them while I Hangout. Easy to use and set up, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for about 3-4 months
customer_reviews.text: The tank worked well for about 3-4 months but for the past 2 months the water becomes dirty and foggy within 3 days of changing the water. Ive cleaned out the whole system and tank but i think the filter/pump has stopped working. Only 2 fish. Would not recommend this product for purchase. Going to contact seller for replacement or refund
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Shattered!
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to setting up this beautiful aquarium. Unfortunately, Amazon hid the manufacturer’s shipping box that clearly stated “fragile glass” inside of their own plain shipping box. So I received a shattered tank and got multiple glass slivers just from opening the box. They’re sending a replacement in two days, hopefully this one will be in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Preemienurse

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful aquarium, and my betta loves it. The quality is great, except for one small piece. The plastic cover that covers the filter compartment is a joke. It will not stay where it's supposed to and it is bowed downward in the middle, so the glass lid cannot slide under it. It seems that they could come up with a better cover for this beautiful tank, considering that the quality of the rest of the package is great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real glass!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the quality of the tank. I did not expect it to be glass. The filter works really well. There is plenty of room to upgrade the pump if you want more flow. Most fish like to swim side to side. This would be a good tank for small mid level dwelling fish. I had 5 large mollies in it and it seemed kinda small. Would make a good grow out tank for babies. These are real plants.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank with a fast flowing filter
customer_reviews.text: Just received my tank. Love the look n the fish look so much happier. Cons are the flow of the pump is heavy. You can see in the pictures the movements of the water. N it's not easy to adjust. I'm gonna try again tomorrow to figure it out. The suction isn't the best for the filter
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Great for bettas and beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my betta. I felt bad keeping him in glass bowl, so he got a major upgrade. I like both of the light settings and took advantage of them with decorations. The filter flow was a little strong for him, even on the lowest setting. I fixed this by puncturing 5 holes in the tube. It slowed it down a lot and he seems to be enjoying him new home. I like that it came with pretty much everything. The only thing I wish it car with was a heater.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Pearson

customer_reviews.title: A great starter tank. Easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Ok. We love this tank! I would change a few things about it but I still love it. It's beautiful and great quality. The back compartment is very narrow and hard to get your hand into. The piece of plastic that goes over the back is very flimsy but if you're not planning on man handling it then you're good. I love the seamless edges and the size is great. It's very quiet and the two different light options are beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Tank
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tank for my daughter to put a Betta in. It was easy to set up and is just beautiful. The portrait layout is a great space saver and very attractive and different. Glad we went with this glass tank over a plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Peculiar4

customer_reviews.title: Unavailable replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive 5 gallon aquarium but I had a couple of issues with it. The main problem was the elbow attachment to pump fell off twice. Unfortunately, because of the design of the tank...its not easy to get once it falls down and i had to dump out the water and fish into another container to fetch it. Frustrating beyond belief. Also, it developed a crack and replacement parts are NOT AVAILABLE. I bought water proof tape which helped but now it is detaching from pump. I decided to buy another 5 gallon tank, Fluval, who has replacement parts readily available.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ferrigno

customer_reviews.title: Suction was so strong - It kept sucking the fish to the filter and killing them
customer_reviews.text: My kiddos were so excited to get a fish tank and a new fish. We loved the way this tank looked - however the suction was so strong it kept killing the fish - i cant tell you how many times i had to go buy a new fish for the kiddos. Immediately after turning the filter on - the fish would begin spinning in the tornado fashion and eventually end up sucked up against the filter dead. With the filter off - the water gets absolutely disgusting SOO fast and the fish dies again. VERY DISSAPOINTED. Not worth the money unless you want to spend tons of money replacing the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Heald

customer_reviews.text: has a rear comparment uncleanable with submersed pump, like a cave the neo cardinia hide there. i do not recommend because of this hollow back section. the black backing is easily removed. Not for small animals. other than that i like the sound of the water spout splashing. snails make their way into the cave and into the submersed pump. mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsie

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and clean modern looking design!
customer_reviews.text: What I love most about this 5 gallon tank is its slick design and how quiet it is. Easy to set up and maintain. I personally like the light design I got from the 3 gal tank so I swapped it with the original one that had came with this 5 gal. My Bettas are happy with their new home so it’s a definite recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Khoi Tran

customer_reviews.title: 1 star for appearance
customer_reviews.text: I paid $250+ for this and it leaked all over. My Betta fish got sick too. Seriously, what else could go wrong? I moved my sick fish to a small, plastic tank and he recovered. I’m now going to use this tank as a dry display and definitely not going to put a pet in it. I gave it one star for appearance only. Would like my money back, but I doubt that will happen.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Well, this top is really built to last!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this 5 gallon tank! Easy to set up, quiet and very attractive. But don't do what I did. I purchased a beautiful black betta, not thinking about the black back drop. Couldn't see the little guy. So I went to the local pet store and purchased a 1.5 gallon tank for him and purchased a white betta. Much better! And as you can see from the picture, the top is well constructed!!!! LOL
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good value
customer_reviews.text: I got this tank for my betta. I think that it is overall a good tank and a good value. The only reason I don't rate it five stars is the filter cover design is lacking. I find it constantly falling off when I feed my fish and it has warped (I've owned the tank for about 6 months now). Also it would be nice to have a feeding hole on top of the tank, but this isn't the end of the world. The overall quality of the tank seems pretty good and the light and pump are great.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Snow

customer_reviews.title: Very nice + decent price
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable filter is very handy, I set it to the lowest setting for my betta and have had no trouble with him getting stuck to the intake. The outflow I had a little trouble with because it kept pushing him down no matter how I positioned it, so I stuffed a bit plastic plant in the hole. Water gets through fine, just slower. Very attractive tank overall, small footprint with sturdy base, but next time ill go with one that's longer than tall.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tank BUT Smaller fish go missing...
customer_reviews.text: I like the glass top piece. Beautiful glass tank. BUT... the holes going into the filter compartment are too large for smaller fish. I have guppies that were disappearing. I found them in the filter compartment and it took days to try and get them out. I put a screen over the holes but then particles were not getting filtered out. I finally gave up and bought a different tank without the back compartment. That way I have more control over the filters, and there is more room in the tank. Didn't like the light because if you placed the tank higher that your eye level the light was always in your eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: Glass sides
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have commented, the pump is too powerful for Bettas. I solved the problem by cutting a hole on the rubber elbow at the top of the filter return tube. This allows some of the return water to be fed back to the filter chamber. The rubber is hard to cut but a sharp exact o or other knife will do it. start small and increase until the desired flow us achieved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally UNUSABLE.... :(
customer_reviews.text: SO disappointed... Can NOT use at all - The shipping package was excellent. But half the components are missing from Marineland. - hoses, instructions, filters, broken glass cover...... ughhh. AND now the price is reduced? Now are my fish stuck in a soup bowl for another week... My fault for being so trusting.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tank for a betta
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tank for a betta. Filter is a bit strong for a betta so the output needs to be baffled. I baffled mine with a pre-filter sponge for the fluval edge. It stretches so it fits snug around the fan shaped output. Just add a betta leaf near the top so your little guy can chill at the surface to get air and you're good to go. Pic attached: Betta leaf hadn't come yet. Mopani wood 6-8 inch, fluval (african something, I forget ) leaf decoration, double tail halfmoon betta.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja

customer_reviews.title: It's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Have to give it a 3 star rating, it's a decent tank and all, but for being a 5 gallon tank, you would obviously be putting smaller fish in it, there are vents on the back of the tank that small fish might fit through (one fish went missing when I first added the fish to the tank.) There is vents in the middle and the top, both of which the food will go into almost before the fish can get to it, and I like to use duck weed and you cant with this tank without making some sort of barrier for the top filter. If you added the barrier it might fix the food and duckweed problem.
customer_reviews.author: ConcentratedBacon

customer_reviews.title: So far
customer_reviews.text: I just got this yesterday. Took it out of the box to check if it made it ok. Did just fine in the shipping. Then wanted to make sure that the things I wanted after 20 years were there. And yes protection for fish is in there. I gave away a 50 gallon tank back then. From a divorce and never wanted to see 1 again. Then I found shrimp was a big thing. This little tank is great for beginners but also great for re-learning something new. And for me that is shrimp. It will take a little while to set it up and will let you know how that goes. But so far its perfect
customer_reviews.author: Chi E.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: WOW beautiful tank
customer_reviews.text: Love the rounded glass corners and the black plastic divider between the tank and the built-in filtration. It makes the tank look like it's a mini display tank in an aquarium or fish store. The black functions as a nice background for the entire tank and makes my plants, shrimp, and fish really pop with with color due to the contrast. Filtration is easy to clean, simple, and works well for what I need (my last tank like this had the filter break - this is a MUCH better tank with high quality parts).
customer_reviews.author: Evalynne Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good tank for beginners... kinda
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this tank. It has a built in filter system, and i love the portrait form. The problem is cleaning. The rear filter chamber gets REALLY REALLY dirty. Cleaning it out really is a project. So while its easy to setup and getting filter cartridges may be convenient... the first time you need to clean it, it'll be an eye opener.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: MarineLand 5 Gallon Portrait Glass LED Aquarium Kit
product_meta.description: Size:5 GALThe Marineland 5 Gallon Portrait Kit is a five gallon curved glass aquarium. The kit includes Marineland's 3-stage hidden filtration with a Rite-Size Z Cartridge, Marineland Bio-Foam, and an adjustable flow filter pump. The bright white and blue energy-efficient LED light is hinged for easy access to the tank, and features a 3-way switch to toggle between white and blue, off, and blue-only settings. The white LEDs create a shimmering light in the water that mimic the underwater effect of sunlight, and the blue LEDs produce a relaxing moonlight glow. Also included is a base and a unique glass canopy that slides to the back of the aquarium for easy feeding and water care dosing. This easy-to-assemble kit is beautifully designed and easy to maintain.
feature_bullets: Focused on the healthy living of your aquatic pets
Quality designed and tested for highest performance
Don't Settle for anything less, use Aquaria Products
HIDDEN FILTRATION: Advanced, 3-stage filtration is out of sight, enhancing aquarium viewing.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
